privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: This page explains clearly how we collect, use, share, and protect your data when you use DutchLearn.
privacy.footerNote: This text is for informational purposes and may be updated from time to time as the service evolves.

intro.title: Summary
intro.text: We do not sell your data. We only process the minimum data required to provide the service, keep it secure, and improve your experience.

data.title: What data do we collect?
data.text: To run and improve the service, we may process the following categories of data:

items.1: Account data: basic identifiers such as email.
items.2: Learning data: completed lessons, quiz results, and progress records.
items.3: Technical data: device/browser info, error logs, and security logs.
items.5: Support messages: requests and messages you send us.
items.6: Legal records: when required by law.

usage.title: How do we use data?
usage.text: We use data only for the following purposes:

items.1: Authentication, account management, and session security.
items.2: Showing progress and personalizing the learning experience.
items.3: Debugging, performance improvements, and quality upgrades.
items.5: Responding to support requests and managing user communication.

sharing.title: Data sharing
sharing.text: We do not sell your data. Limited sharing may be necessary to provide the service:

items.1: Hosting/infrastructure providers: to operate the application.
items.2: Authentication and security services: to protect your account.
items.3: Legal obligation: valid requests from authorities.
items.4: Always: minimal-data principle, only what is necessary.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.text: Cookies may be used for session, security, and remembering preferences:

items.2: Preference cookies: language and UI settings.
items.3: Analytics: only when necessary and anonymized where possible.

retention.title: Retention period
retention.text: We keep data only as long as needed:

items.1: Account data: while your account is active.
items.2: Logs: limited time for security and debugging.

rights.title: Your rights
rights.text: Depending on local law, you may have the following rights:

items.6: File a complaint with the competent authority.

security.title: Security
security.text: We apply technical and organizational measures to protect your data:

items.3: Abuse prevention, monitoring, and incident management.

changes.title: Policy changes
changes.text: We may update this text. For significant changes, we will inform you appropriately.

items.1: The updated date will be refreshed on this page.
items.2: Major changes may include additional notices.

contact.title: Contact
contact.text: For privacy-related questions or requests, you can reach us at:

items.3: Response time: as soon as possible
